page.title: 17A DAY IN THE LIFE OF ALAN
page.content: The day starts at 4.00am for my dad. He gets up, has his breakfast and he has to be at work by 5.00am. He is a postman. When he gets there he has to sort the letters into the right deliveries, he sorts 1500 letters an hour. When all the letters have been sorted they are put in the streets and villages in numerical order. The postman always puts his own letters and parcels into the van for his round. They leave the post office at 7.00am and my dad delivers about 3000 letters in Thundridge. The round ends at 12.00 noon with the collection of mail from the boxes. His day is then over at work. There are three rounds which each postman works on in turn. This means that once every three weeks Dad delivers our post. They are all village deliveries so they are all done by van.
